title: Need help with the Calphalon Logo
content:
Hello all.

I just discovered this site and this is my first post. I have to say..this is a very nice site and I can see it becoming a valuable resource for me..Kudos all around.

So I’m working on a project for Macy’s and need to recreate the Calphalon logo, because as usual, they cant get me a vector copy. I need to figure out what the font is.

Any help is much appreciated

[Here is the Logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201144140/http:/www.milners.com.au/cache/images/1/190x100/calphalon_logo.gif)

Thanks a bunch

Copper

 [‹ Is it Shango? Schneider Initials? Something else?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201144140/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49526 "Go to previous forum topic") [Familiar looking serif ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201144140/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49434 "Go to next forum topic")
author: cbjhockey61

comments.content: Looks like a version of [Cheltenham Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201144140/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=cheltenham&x=0&y=0&sample_text=Calphalon) to me.

It sure does...looks as though it has been altered to give the tops of the letters that little bit of diagonal. And the a’s are wacked too.

Thanks for the Help!

Copper

You need to know about [Brands of the World](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201144140/http:/www.brandsoftheworld.com/), a site that has vectors for oodles of brand logos. [They have it](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201144140/http:/www.brandsoftheworld.com/search/64453231/33133.html).
